results.title: Love on the run = L'Amour en fuite
results.creator_credit: AMLF, Films du Carrosse and Francois Truffaut
results.brief_description: Fifth and final installment of Francois Truffaut’s “Antoine Doinel” cycle. Largely a series of flashbacks, this episode sees Antoine about to be divorced, and hence, reflective about his life. He is in love with Sabine but is filled with conflict about his responsibilities, in particular, his son, and is introspective the about the past. Aboard a train Antoine meets up with former love, Colette, and although they initially recall the past fondly, she subsequently berates Antoine for his lack of maturity and enduring self-absorption. This bittersweet work was largely derided as a disappointing end to an iconic series, but it maintains the lyricism and comical whimsy that are signatures of Truffauts “Doinel” work, whilst also being the most mediative.

results.title: Love on a slice of bread = Cinta dalam sepotong roti
results.creator_credit: Prasidi Teta Film, Budiyati Abiyoga and Garin Nugroho
results.brief_description: Director Garin Nugroho’s first feature is the story of three childhood friends caught in a love triangle. Topan, a photographer, visits his childhood friends who have married each other. The three of them end up travelling to Lombok together, which proves to be not such a good idea. The husband is revealed to be sexually incompetent and he ends up having an affair with Topan’s photographic model (although to what extent remains unclear as the film was censored by the Indonesian Censorship Board). Meanwhile, Mayang finds out that she has more in common with Topan than her husband. This is arguably Nugroho’s most mainstream effort. Later on, he went on to develop his hallmark strengths - intricate cultural nuances, sparse dialogue and a sense of hightened realism. This film won Best Film at the Indonesian Film Festival in 1991 and Best young Director at the Asia-Pacific Film Festival in South Korea in the same year. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Love of life
results.creator_credit: Norfolk Communications, Ian Paterson and David Cobham
results.brief_description: Based on the Jack London story of how much one man endures in his quest for survival in the Klondike region during the gold rush days.

results.title: Love nest
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Jules Buck and Joseph Newman
results.brief_description: When serviceman Jim Scott (William Lundigan) returns home after 2 1/2 years in the Army he finds his wife, Connie (June Haver), has bought a run down apartment block and assumed the role of landlady at 337 Grammercy Place. Eager to resume his writing, he soon learns that the landlord is always home, and with a suspected Casanova swindler as a tenant, and a jealous wife following the arrival of Jim’s beautiful Army buddy WAC Bobby (Marilyn Monroe), it will take something exceptional to get his writing off the ground and save the decrepit building from being condemned. Cast also includes Frank Fay, Leatrice Joy and Jack Parr. Based on the novel by Scott Corbett. Includes the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Love my dog
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach Studios, Hal Roach and Robert F. McGowan
results.brief_description: Silent slapstick comedy featuring “Our Gang” and their efforts to prevent Farina’s beloved pooch being caught and put down by a dog-catcher. Cast includes Joe Cobb, Jackie Condon, Dick Gilbert, Allen “Farina” Hoskins, Scooter Lowry. Silent film with English captions.

results.title: Love me, love my dog
results.brief_description: In Great Britain each year 70,000 accidents and 3,000 human casualties are caused by dogs on the roads, and we see how Barbara Woodhouse and the Croxley Canine Training Society train dogs and their owners in road safety.

results.title: Love me tender
results.creator_credit: Robert D Webb, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and David Weisbart
results.brief_description: Love Me Tender is most noteable for being Elvis Presley’s cinematic debut and the launching pad for one of his most recognisable hits Love Me Tender. The story of the Reno brothers starts at the end of the Civil War. Presley is Clint Reno a young farmer trying to keep the family farm running after the family are told that the oldest brother, Vance Reno has been killed in battle. Believing his brother is dead, Clint and Vance’s sweetheart Kathy marry. However, Vance returns with the intention of marrying Kathy. Clint receives reassurance from Vance that he bears no resentment towards the pair. However, the trios relationships with one another are soon tested when Vance is arrested and taken away for trial. This one event leads the trio to a climatic encounter that ends tragicly for all. While in the majority of the film Presley gets to display his acting ability the story is broken up with Presley singing and dancing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert D Webb, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and David Weisbart

results.title: Love me or leave me
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joe Pasternak and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: Show-casing her dramatic capabilities, Doris Day gives a surprising performance as the 1930’s torch singer Ruth Etting. Etting’s big break came when she was discovered by Chicago gangster Martin, “The Gimp” Snyder. Using the ruthless methods that he is accustomed to, the Gimp fulfills Ruth’s ambitions by providing her with material riches and renown on stage and screen. He also provides her with his hand in marriage. She pays a high cost personally however, living in an atmosphere of violence and fear that worsens when Martin discovers that Ruth has fallen in love with musician Johnny Alderman (Cameron Mitchell). Nominated for 6 Academy Awards, “Love me or leave me” is a departure from traditional musicals as it focuses on the trials and tribulations of love, fear and tragedy in relationships, played out against a backdrop of songs such as “Mean to me”, “Ten cents a dance” and “I’ll never stop loving you”. Cast also includes Robert Keith and Tom Tully.

results.title: Love Letters from Teralba Road
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Richard Brennan and Stephen Wallace
results.brief_description: This excellent film was one of the first significant films of the revived Australian film industry to focus on working-class characters. It has a raw, painful and moving story, based on real love letters uncovered in a flat in Newcastle by director Stephen Wallace, and the first impressive screen performance from a young Bryan Brown. Cast also includes Kris McQuade, Gia Carides, Joy Hruby, Kevin Leslie, Ashe Venn. Photography by Tom Cowan, assistant photography by Martha Ansara.
